text: You're going to hear five people talking about the experience of working from home.

For me, it has been a fantastic change. I used to spend over an hour every morning just driving to work in heavy traffic. Now, I use that time to exercise or have a proper breakfast with my family. I feel much more relaxed when I start my work day.

I honestly find it quite difficult. I live in a small apartment and I don't have a separate room for an office. I have to work at the kitchen table, which is uncomfortable. Also, my neighbors can be very noisy during the day, so it is hard to concentrate.

I miss the social side of the job. At the office, we often solved problems just by chatting while getting a coffee. At home, you have to write an email or schedule a call for everything. It feels a bit lonely and the work actually takes longer.

The biggest benefit is definitely financial. Before, I was spending a large part of my salary on train tickets and buying lunch at restaurants near the office. Now, I cook at home and save hundreds of pounds a month. It makes a big difference to my budget.

I think the best solution is a mix of both. It is good to stay home when you need to focus on a big project without interruptions. But, it is also important to go in once or twice a week to see your team. Companies should offer a hybrid model.
